reviews.review: Half Life 2 was a surprisingly fun game for me. It has aged incredibly well. What stood out the most to me was the level design. Each chapter felt unique and had their own atmosphere that made the game consistently exciting. The only thing that wouldn't hold up to today's standards would be the graphics which are really good for 2004.
It's a great game, just like pretty much everyone said

the combat is great, the guns are great, and also has some pretty satisfying puzzles
but doctor kleiner might kill you

Одна из самых лучших игр на ПК. Это моя первая игра которую я купил. И у меня о ней только теплые воспоминания. Даже для 2021 года эта игра крайне крута. Я и не думал что на моем тостере 2011г. но она пошла на высоких настройках. Больше мне нечего сказать об этой игре, ведь благодаря ней я стал фанатом серий игр Халф Лайф. P.S. Я хочу купить 1 халву и все дополнения ко всем частям

What's your secret, Valve? How do you outdo yourselves every time? You have your pitfalls and still manage to be king of the hill. Even though this game looks primitive today, this was and is a masterpiece from the early 2000's. No game series sticks with me so prominently like Half-Life; it's something I think about fairly regularly. Whether it's from stupid internet memes or just a gaze at the incredible science fiction of it all, Half-Life will be a part of my life always. It's a game that grew up with me. I was only a teenager when I got the first game, hardly able to understand and appreciate everything HL did, yet Freeman's story resonated with me in a way that really burned this game into my mind.
Changed my life. Allowed me to quit my job to pursue the resistance. Thank you Gabe.

La sortie de Half-Life en 1998 aura indéniablement marqué un tournant dans l'histoire du jeu vidéo et dans la vie de nombreux joueurs. Celle de sa suite n'aura donc pas manqué de se faire attendre.
Si elle connaîtra du retard, notamment lié à de fâcheux événements, elle sera maintenue grâce aux efforts et à la motivation  des équipes de Valve. Et le moins qu'on puisse dire, c'est que le résultat a été à la hauteur, voire même au-delà.
Le jeu prend place des années après les événements du premier, dans un monde totalitaire où l'administrateur de Black Mesa a pactisé avec l'envahisseur venu de Xen.
Une frange des humains s'est alliée aux anciens escalves Vortigaunts afin de tenir tête à leurs oppresseurs et tenter de les renverser.
Inaugurant un tout nouveau moteur offrant une gestion de la physique plus poussée que le précédent, Half-Life 2 n'a pas manqué de s'inscrire dans les standards de son époque. Le jeu s'est alors paré d'un nouvel habillage graphique et sonore qui conserve encore son charme, même si certaines textures paraissent maintenant grossières.
Half-Life se passait essentiellement dans les laboratoires de Black Mesa puis sur la planète Xen, ce ne sera pas le cas ici, mais le jeu ne manquera pas de faire voyager le joueur en lui faisant traverser des environnements tous plus variés les uns que les autres, tantôt à pied, tantôt à bord d'un véhicule.
Half-Life 2 tout comme son aîné fait la part belle à l'exploration et aux combats, mettant d'ailleurs à profit sa gestion de la physique, permettant d'aborder les situations de manière plus ingénieuse.
Au chapitre des reproches je dirais que les combats sont parfois trop intenses pour les joueurs les moins aguerris, parfois difficiles voire pénibles à négocier, ce qui sera le cas dans les épisodes suivants.
Quoi qu'il en soit Half-Life 2 est un savant cocktail d'ingrédients qui ont fait du jeu un classique intemporel : son histoire, ses personnages, le voyage qu'il propose, son ambiance et son univers.
C'est pourquoi ce jeu et ses suites restent cultes pour de nombreux joueurs encore aujourd'hui, au plus grand étonnement d'autres joueurs dont les standards ont radicalement évolué avec le temps.

I can honestly say that this is one of my favourite games on steam, mostly bacause its still fun 17 (?) years after its original release.

Largement mieux que le précédent, les graphismes sont encore d'une qualité impressionnante aujourd'hui.
Le gameplay change quand même reficalement par rapport au volume précédent avec de nouvelles mécaniques (véhicules, mantes religieuses, Gravity gun et alyx...) 
Et je trouve toujours qu'il est préférable de jouer au no1 pour bien comprendre l'histoire.

Un jeu auquel il est nécessaire de jouer !

My first playthrough, 16yrs late. 

I owed it to myself to play this game that is constantly given the best game ever award by various gamers. At the on sale price of a measly few quid it's hard to not give it a thumbs up. With the endless perfect game reviews i envisaged something truly enjoyable for an oldschool FPS fan. I honestly didn't know what to expect in terms of story, music, or gameplay, though i know i left feeling disappointed due to the near perfect reviews. 

My issues with the game. 
Poor gunplay. The guns were just not that special. The grav gun obviously an exception. They just didn't sound that great, the variety wasn't there, and they didn't feel like they had much punch overall. The secondary fire from the auto rifle and pulse rifle were fun, but just weren't common in ammo pickups. Same for the bow, cool weapon, but i just didn't get to use it much. I felt like there wasn't much ammo for the magnum around also, yet offering less DPS than the shotgun which ammo was aplenty.

The music. I don't know what went wrong here, but the music was rarely was rarely playing, which detracts from the immersion. 

The overly long vehicle sections. The hovercraft section was really quite boring, but finished on an epic boss battle with the enemy aircraft which was quite enjoyable. 

No melee button. The constant smashing of boxes was fine but took too long to blow up with whatever weapon i had equipped. So either weaker boxes or a melee button (crowbar) would of been favourable.

The story. I just didn't 'get' the story. It felt like it was just a 'go here do this' game, which is fine, it's a FPS game. But random NPCs appearing just slowed the game down for me, it also felt out of place despite the scenario sometimes. I didn't care for Alyx whatsoever, but the robot dog and Lamarr were cool additions and added enjoyment to my playthrough of the game. 

The ending was just poor i felt. The few levels up to this i was just a bit disappointed already so wasn't really bothered by the cliff hanger.

These few issues is what toppled the game for me. I'd have probably overlooked these if the game wasn't rated so highly, or i had played the game in 2004. 

However. Things i did enjoy. 
The level design, very well thought out, fun puzzles as well. This was the most enjoyable thing about the game, i could feel the same enjoyment was there as when i was playing other FPS games for the first time 'back then'. The platforming sections equally very memorable. Just the vehicle sections were poorly implemented. 

Grav gun fun. Need i say more.

Enemies. The Combine filled their roll nicely enough, but the zombies gave good atmosphere, the Striders were a cool addition for boss type battles (but better weapons would of made this experience more fun), and the Antlions were pretty funny. 

Overall, solid game but not without its issues. A modern remake of this i would be thoroughly interested in. 

I don't think i'll bother with the DLC for a while, but am intrigued about HL1.

ok listen. half-life is just like heroin and trust me i know this, because i am a heroin addict. you'll become addicted very fast and you will want to play it more and as often as you can. it will be the single greatest thing in the entire world to you. if you can't play it, you will feel a serious craving for more. playing it the first time will be your best memory of all time. after that it will never be as good as the first time was, but still fucking amazing. just like heroin, if you've never tried it before you die, you will have seriously missed an amazing experience. the only downsight to half-life is, that there is no substitution treatment for half-life addicts, unless you own a VR headset or have iron patience. seriously you have to play all the half-life games and expansions, they are all great.
Half Life series are the best games.
